metaDescription: Luxurious 2-bedroom villa in Vistabella Golf, Orihuela. Premium specification at 40% less than island markets. Mediterranean escape awaits.
heroIntro:
Imagine waking to Mediterranean sunshine, stepping onto your own private terrace, and planning a day between pristine beaches and championship golf courses. This isn't a fantasy—it's your reality with this exceptional 2-bedroom villa in Vistabella Golf, Orihuela. At €351,000, you're securing a premium specification home at 40% less than comparable properties on Spanish islands, making this an intelligent investment in your holiday escape.

Orihuela represents the authentic Costa Blanca experience: genuine Spanish culture meets established international community, golden beaches meet verdant golf courses, and Mediterranean warmth meets affordable luxury. This villa embodies everything you've imagined about owning a Spanish holiday home—without the island premium price tag.

With 73 square meters of thoughtfully designed living space set on 158 square meters of private plot, every detail has been optimized for the holiday lifestyle. Whether you're planning extended getaways, rental income opportunities, or a permanent escape from grey winters, this property delivers the sunshine retreat you've been seeking.
areaSection:
Orihuela, in southern Alicante province, is where Costa Blanca's authentic character thrives. Situated inland yet just 20 minutes from multiple Blue Flag beaches, it offers the perfect balance between seaside access and traditional Spanish living. The area benefits from over 300 days of annual sunshine and a temperate Mediterranean climate that makes outdoor living a year-round pleasure.

The town boasts rich historical roots dating back centuries, visible in its charming architecture and vibrant local culture. Unlike crowded coastal resorts, Orihuela maintains genuine Spanish authenticity while welcoming an established international community. The surrounding region combines agricultural heritage with modern amenities, creating a uniquely appealing setting for those seeking genuine Mediterranean lifestyle rather than tourist-focused developments.
lifestyleSection:
Daily life in Orihuela flows between relaxation and activity, exactly as you'd hoped. Your mornings might begin with café con leche at a local bar before heading to one of several nearby championship golf courses. Afternoons are flexible: siesta at home, beach time 20 minutes away, or exploring local markets filled with fresh Mediterranean produce.

The international community here is established and welcoming—English is widely spoken, and you'll find fellow property owners from across Europe and beyond. Healthcare access is excellent with English-speaking doctors and modern private clinics complementing the regional hospital. Shopping ranges from international supermarkets (Mercadona, Lidl, Consum) to authentic local markets offering weekly fresh produce. Restaurants serve everything from traditional paella to international cuisine, and the evening paseo (evening stroll) remains a cherished social tradition.
investmentSection:
Beyond personal enjoyment, this villa represents compelling investment logic. Costa Blanca property values have increased 8% year-on-year, with Orihuela outperforming regional averages due to infrastructure improvements and international interest. At €4,808 per square meter, you're paying 40% less than equivalent properties on Mallorca or Ibiza—yet enjoying identical Mediterranean lifestyle.

Rental potential is substantial. Comparable 2-bedroom villas in Vistabella typically command €800 per week during peak season, generating potential annual returns of €20,000+ from 6-month seasonal lettings. Many owners operate successful hybrid models: personal use during preferred months, professional management and rental income during peak demand. The established community and golf course amenities make this particularly attractive to international holiday renters seeking authentic Costa Blanca experiences.
conclusion:
This €351,000 villa in Vistabella Golf represents far more than a property purchase—it's the Mediterranean holiday lifestyle you've imagined, at a price that makes genuine sense. With premium specification at 40% less than island markets, established community amenities, and substantial rental income potential, you're securing genuine value in an appreciating market.

Orihuela delivers authentic Spanish culture combined with international convenience. Year-round sunshine, nearby beaches, championship golf, and affordable living create the lifestyle context you've envisioned. Whether this is your escape from winter months, investment property generating consistent returns, or eventual permanent retirement home, the fundamentals are compelling.

faqs.question: Ile kosztuje ta nieruchomość?
faqs.answer: €351,000. This 2-bedroom, 2-bathroom villa in Vistabella Golf represents exceptional value for premium specification Costa Blanca property. You're purchasing at €4,808 per square meter—40% less than comparable properties on Spanish islands like Mallorca or Ibiza, yet with identical Mediterranean lifestyle access.

faqs.question: Czy obcokrajowcy mogą kupić nieruchomość w Hiszpanii?
faqs.answer: Yes, foreigners can freely purchase property in Spain without restrictions. EU, UK, and international buyers have identical purchasing rights. You'll need a Spanish tax identification number (NIE) and should engage a Spanish solicitor to handle the legal process. No visa is required for property purchase.

faqs.question: Jakie są koszty zakupu nieruchomości w Hiszpanii?
faqs.answer: Beyond the €351,000 purchase price, expect additional costs of approximately 8-10% total: property transfer tax (ITP, approximately 6-7%), notary and registration fees (approximately 1.5%), and legal/solicitor fees (approximately 1-2%). Total estimated investment: €378,000-€386,000. These are standard Spanish purchase costs.

faqs.question: Czy Costa Blanca to dobre miejsce na zakup nieruchomości?
faqs.answer: Tak, Costa Blanca to doskonałe property investment market. The region experiences consistent 8% annual value appreciation, attracts international buyer demand, and offers strong seasonal rental income potential. Orihuela specifically offers affordable entry pricing while maintaining established infrastructure and international community.

faqs.question: Jakie są koszty życia na Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Cost of living in Orihuela and Costa Blanca is significantly lower than northern Europe. Dining out costs €8-15 per person for quality meals, supermarket shopping is 20-30% cheaper than UK prices, and utilities are modest. A comfortable lifestyle costs €1,200-1,600 monthly, substantially less than equivalent living in France, UK, or Scandinavia.

faqs.question: Czy mogę uzyskać kredyt hipoteczny w Hiszpanii jako obcokrajowiec?
faqs.answer: Yes, foreign buyers can obtain Spanish mortgages, typically up to 80% of property value. UK, EU, and international banks offer mortgages with rates currently around 3-4%. You'll need proof of income, deposit of 20%, and Spanish tax identification. Engage a Spanish mortgage broker to navigate options.

faqs.question: Czy Costa Blanca jest dobra dla emerytów?
faqs.answer: Excellent. Costa Blanca attracts thousands of retirees seeking affordable living, year-round sunshine, and established international communities. Healthcare is accessible with English-speaking doctors, cost of living is budget-friendly, and the social infrastructure supports retirees well. Orihuela specifically offers authentic Spanish culture alongside international amenities.

faqs.question: Jaka jest pogoda na Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Costa Blanca enjoys over 300 days annual sunshine with temperate Mediterranean climate. Winters average 12-16°C (mild, rarely freezing), summers reach 28-32°C (warm without extreme heat). Rainfall is minimal (200mm annually), and sea temperatures permit swimming April-November. Perfect for year-round outdoor living.

faqs.question: Jak daleko jest Costa Blanca od Polski?
faqs.answer: Alicante-Elche Airport, 30 minutes from this property, offers direct flights to most major UK cities (London, Manchester, Birmingham, Glasgow). Flight time is typically 2-2.5 hours. Budget airlines (Ryanair, easyJet, Wizz Air) operate frequent routes with competitive fares, making weekend trips to UK easily affordable.

faqs.question: What rental income can this property generate?
faqs.answer: Comparable 2-bedroom villas in Vistabella Golf typically achieve €800 per week (€3,200 per month) during peak season (June-September). Conservative annual projections using 6-month seasonal lettings suggest €20,000-24,000 annual rental income. Many owners combine personal use with professional management to maximize returns.
